issue.title: Where's BarbBlock?
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

BarbBlock suddenly disappeared from AdGuard. I researched why it disappeared, and it's because the URL changed.

### Proposed solution

Please use the following text file to reintroduce this list:

https://paulgb.github.io/BarbBlock/blacklists/adblock-plus.txt

### Additional information

The domains in this list can detect where blocking is an issue for these companies. They then use these analytics to write cease & desist letters to the developers of the blocklists, forcing them to comply or end up in court. To avoid any issues down the road, please implement this list by default.

comment.body: I'm not sure which category this belongs in. I'll let the AdGuard Team decide.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Where's BarbBlock?

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

BarbBlock suddenly disappeared from AdGuard. I researched why it disappeared, and it's because the URL changed.

### Proposed solution

Please use the following text file to reintroduce this list:

https://paulgb.github.io/BarbBlock/blacklists/adblock-plus.txt

### Additional information

The domains in this list can detect where blocking is an issue for these companies. They then use these analytics to write cease & desist letters to the developers of the blocklists, forcing them to comply or end up in court. To avoid any issues down the road, please implement this list by default.

pull_request.title: Update general_elemhide.txt
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://wogaa.sg/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwogaa.sg%2F) ### Comment > WOGAA.sg is Singapore's government website to host some of Singapore's government services. I was having trouble making payment for a government related service because fetching a Javascript from the domain came with an error. On browser webpage inspection, the GET function threw a ERR_ADDRESS_INVALID error, and I double checked the main site domain with all my browsers it also came with the same error. On troubleshooting with a proxy server, the website showed up again. I believe AdGuard either has wrongly blocked this domain and should be marked as safe or the domain is not found on its domain name server list. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/bixem6cs8wococwwco0wwc4sswkocgsg7te8ycz2rs.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/tvnvcwsy4gg8wg8g0wwkg40kg0o4og4h8k75qsbre8.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- Platform: | AdGuard DNS Browser: | All browsers Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Could not reproduce the Anti Adblock on my end with your settings. Please try adding 
`cutsy.net#%#//scriptlet('prevent-fetch', 'pagead2.googlesyndication.com')`
to user rules and test the page again. 
Check if your filters are updated, clear your browser cache. If it doesn't help - please send filtering log with all blocked requests.

comment.body:
I don't think this banner should be hidden as it is part of the site content. Please add this rule to the user rules to block it:
`cnbc.com##div[class^="RelatedStories-styles-makeit"]`
Also, with the AdGuard Social Media filter enabled, the "share" icons should be blocked, the screenshot shows that they are not blocked. Please try reinstalling the AdGuard security certificate, clear your browser cache and check the page again. If filtering problems continue, please write to support@adguard.com.

Hi @Alex-302 

As written before, I've checked that by disabling all filters and re-enable those one after the other. The only setting that works is not to grant access to DuckDuckGo. 

On my side it's a reproducible issue, happy to hear that you are not affected.  I have to deal with disabling AdGuard on DDG. 

Regards,
Tom
